newsitem.title: USA: Storm Primax cuts IPO size, price range.
newsitem.headline: Storm Primax cuts IPO size, price range.

text.p: Storm Primax Inc, in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, said it had cut both the number of shares and the estimated price range for its upcoming initial public offering.
The company will offer 2.75 million shares, down from 3.7 million, in a range of $9 to $11 each, down from $10 to $12, the filing said.
Goldman Sachs is the lead underwriter of the offering, which is tentatively scheduled for mid-September.
Storm Primax has filed to trade on the Nasdaq under the symbol "EASY."
Of the shares to be sold, two million will be sold by the company and 750,000 by shareholders.
The company is based in Sunnyvale, Calif.
